### Critical Fortinet FortiWeb WAF Bug Exploited in the Wild


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a severe vulnerability found in Fortinet's FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF), which has been actively exploited by attackers. Identified as CVE-2021-26122, the vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote code execution due to improper neutralization of special elements in input data. Researchers emphasize the critical nature of this flaw, urging users to immediately apply the necessary patches released by Fortinet to mitigate potential risks. The exploit's discovery underscores the ongoing threats faced by web applications

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.darkreading.com/application-security/critical-fortinet-fortiweb-waf-bug-exploited-in-wild?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_1819)**

### Digital Doppelgangers: Anatomy of Evolving Impersonation Campaigns Distributing Gh0st RAT


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article "Digital Doppelgangers: Anatomy of Evolving Impersonation Campaigns Distributing Gh0st RAT" explores how cybercriminals are increasingly using advanced impersonation tactics to distribute the Gh0st Remote Access Trojan (RAT). These campaigns cleverly mimic legitimate entities, often through email spoofing and fake websites, to deceive targets into downloading the malware. The Gh0st RAT, once installed, allows attackers to remotely control infected systems, steal sensitive information, and maintain persistent access. The

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/impersonation-campaigns-deliver-gh0st-rat/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_8023)**

### A Surveillance Mandate Disguised As Child Safety: Why the GUARD Act Won't Keep Us Safe


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article critiques the GUARD Act, framing it as a surveillance measure masked as a child safety initiative. It argues that while the act is purportedly designed to protect children, its true aim is to expand government surveillance capabilities, potentially infringing on individual privacy rights. Critics highlight that the act could lead to increased monitoring and data collection without effectively addressing the root causes of threats to child safety. The piece emphasizes the need for legislation that genuinely prioritizes children's safety without compromising the civil liberties of individuals.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/surveillance-mandate-disguised-child-safety-why-guard-act-wont-keep-us-safe?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_4546)**

### Sniffing out TruffleHog in AWS


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


TruffleHog is a tool used to detect sensitive information, such as API keys and passwords, that may be accidentally committed to source code repositories. The article "Sniffing out TruffleHog in AWS" discusses the implementation and effectiveness of using TruffleHog within Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance security measures. It highlights how TruffleHog scans through code to identify potentially exposed credentials, aiding in preventing unauthorized access and securing sensitive data. The piece provides insights into integrating the

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://redcanary.com/blog/threat-detection/trufflehog-aws/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_6649)**

In the article "Lawmakers Want to Ban VPNs‚ÄîAnd They Have No Idea What They're Doing," the author discusses the recent efforts by certain lawmakers to ban the use of Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), despite a limited understanding of the technology. VPNs are crucial for ensuring online privacy and security by encrypting internet traffic and protecting user identity. The article highlights the lack of technological expertise among policymakers, which could lead to unintended consequences and undermine digital privacy and internet freedom.
